Reviews.Content: Two wonderful places to call 'home' in Florence My daughter and I spent the first night of our Florence vacation at Antica Dimora Firenze. It was beautiful! The staff was so helpful! The hospitality was wonderful, they loaned us laptops and DVD's to watch movies. There was a breakfast included but we slept through it. The next day they took us to The Market House, which is a sweet little apartment that they have for the rest of our 11 nights in Florence. It was a wonderful place for a Christmas family reunion. My son (studying abroad) met us there and we really enjoyed being able to give him a home away from home' for Christmas. The kitchen was stocked with olive oil, coffee, tea and a jar of biscotti that kept being refilled. (They even had milk in the fridge for us.) Every three days, maids came to clean and change linens. We were in a great location right near a market and able to but fresh food to prepare meals if we didn't want to eat out. We were within walking distance of everything. At Christmas a special Christmas cake and a poinsettia appeared from the staff. We loved out time together in Florence and the people from Antica Dimora Firenze made it all so fantastic. They even ordered out taxi to the airport as we had to leave at 4:30 am to catch out flight. I would highly recommend both of theses places to stay as well as any of their other properties.Nancy
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth051

Reviews.Content: Beautiful, cosy hotel in a great location We stayed at the Antica Dimora hotel for our honeymoon in December 08 and it was absolutely perfect! The rooms are beautifully decorated and we were made to feel really at home. Amanda, who was a very welcoming hostess, gave us some fantastic recommendations for restaurants, so we ate like a King and Queen, and we left Florence already planning our return visit! Highly recommended!
Reviews.Author: Lisa_Doh

Reviews.Content: Super boutique hotel Very pretty boutique hotel 15 mins walk from central Florence. We stayed in the pink room with a small terrace and it was delightful! Would highly recommend, especially at 115 euros a night when the FX rate was 1.50 to the 拢....!!
Reviews.Author: NicholasGreen

Reviews.Content: good service A very nice bed and breakfast in Florence. The service was very good, and the staff was very helpfull, Breakfast was included and very good. We also liked the room even though it was small.The short way to the center was perfect and we would recommend the hotel :-) and come again if we decide to see more of Florence, a nice city with lots to do and see... Dont forget that it is cold in Florence around desember/january so bring a warm coat
Reviews.Author: elly51Arendal

Reviews.Content: Very good services! My friend and I had stay in this hotel for 3 days, and we had a very good time there. We had spent quite some time to do research on the hotels in Florence and finally chose this hotel, and I believe I made a good choice. This small hotel is clean, cozy, and fairly quite -- when close the window in the room, you almost hear nothing from the street. Also the location of this hotel is almost perfect for us: just 5 minute walk away from the Duomo. Also I had wandered around the streets near hotel in late night, and seemed very safe to me.The staffs there were very helpful to us, answering all kinds of questions from us patiently. Due to my own carelessness, I left my wallet with driver lience in it after checked out, after they found my wallet, they sent me an email immediately, also offering to mail my wallet back to my US address without charge!So, I highly recommend this hotel to people who travel alone or in small group (because it is a small hotel with only 6 rooms :-)).
Reviews.Author: DragontreeCE

Reviews.Content: Very friendly service Booked Antica Dimora Firenze on the recommendations of a friend and was not disappointed. Room was beautiful albeit a little cram with 3 of us and 3 huge pieces of luggage. Bathroom was clean and functional with a good shower. The best part was the very friendly and helpful staff who also provided us with excellent recommendations of restaurants. Location is good with many nice restaurants nearby. All attractions are within easy walking distance. Also worth a mention is the complimentary beverages service throughout the day. A nice touch! Overall, a very pleasant stay.
Reviews.Author: KELVM

Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the Antica Dimora Firenze It was our first time in Italy. We had just come from a week in Rome. Arriving we were shown a room that was nice but did not have a view. We asked and were quickly accommodated with a very nice room in the back, away from the street. Perhaps the best thing at the hotel was the guidance we received on restaurants and shopping. Every suggestion was great. Very pleasant and appreciated the professional quality of the staff.
Reviews.Author: euro386

Reviews.Content: Loved this place Our trip to Florence was really made by staying in this BB. The decor is stylish and charming and all your needs have been catered for. When you arrive home after a full day of sight seeing the atmosphere is very welcoming with warmth, soothing classical music playing and free refreshments waiting for you to help yourself. The manager gave us some top local tips on places to eat and helped us plan the rest of our trip north to Venice. We went on to stay in some expensive hotels on the rest of our tour and were very dissapointed with them in comparison to this little gem of a place.
Reviews.Author: JoneseyScotland

Reviews.Content: Highly recommended       Common area
Reviews.Author: wendy_in_japan

Reviews.Content: Gem of a Bed and Breakfast! We stayed 3 nights in this beautifully decorated and intelligently staffed bed and breakfast. Our comfortable canopied bed, marble bath, and antique furniture added to the romance of this trip. The residence is a very small and personable BB in a seemingly residential area, but just footsteps from the Accademia and the major sights in Florence. The front desk staff helped us so much, we'd like to give them a big hug to say thank you for all they did for us. We got lost driving into Florence, and Viola helped us find our way into the city easily. Amanda helped us organize our sightseeing and our rental car, among other great hints. We enjoyed the honor bar of biscotti and wine (or cocktails) every evening- which helped us unwind after long days of walking around and before dinner.  Our room was apart from the others in the residence, in the front room adjacent to the breakfast room and concierge desk. We slept in luxuriously late and had breakfast right up to it's last couple of minutes at 10:30 am. I'm a light sleeper, so I'm thankful I had my earplugs with me. Despite the little noise, our stay was delightful and we HIGHLY recommend this as your home while you visit Florence!
Reviews.Author: measpinner

Reviews.Content: charming trip in Florence Nice experience, great professionnal staff, especially Umberto who was waiting for our arrival in Florencemany thanks
Reviews.Author: babiol

Reviews.Content: Florentine Gem We recently visited Florence and had the opportunity to stay at the delightful Antica Dimora Firenze! Our room was inviting, large, and bright with a comfortable bed, nice linens and a very large shower. It also had a small balcony that overlooks some rooftop patios and gardens. We really enjoyed the location in a Florentine neighborhood a block away from San Marco which is a gem and must see. The gracious hostess/receptionist at the hotel provided excellent recommendations for things to see that are traditional Florentine and very nice restaurants that are unique and non-tourist. Florence is a beautiful city and Antica Dimora Firenze does everything to help you have a beautiful holiday!
Reviews.Author: CiaoAustin

Reviews.Content: Your home away from home in Florence Our room was beautifully decorated, looking out on a sunny peaceful courtyard behind the building. It was a quiet retreat to come home to after walking the city each day. We also enjoyed taking a bottle of wine to the terrace at the sister property, Antica Johlea, just down the street. The service was excellent and attentive. They made dinner reservations for us (and checked to see whether we had enjoyed the meal) and suggested places to see. Hotel is a 20 minute brisk walk from the Uffizi, so close enough to everything but economically priced.
Reviews.Author: bebediver

Reviews.Content: will return again and again This was my second stay at Antica Dimora and I will return whenever I can. The staff is very helpful and welcoming, they also have some great suggestions for restaurants in Florence. The rooms are chic and are equipped with many extra details not usually found in small hotels.
Reviews.Author: themollusk

Reviews.Content: Market House My wife and I were traveling through Italy on our honeynoon, and came across several positive reviews for Antica Dimora in Florence. Upon further investigation, we found that there is an option to stay at the Market House - an off-site apartment that is run by the Antica Dimora team. If you want to live like a true Florentine, take advantage of this great opportunity. Umberto was so personable and helpful (as well as patient...we were two hours late in meeting him at the apartment.), and the location is great. Just a short walk away from all of the attactions, and the Italian market that is across the street will provide you with fresh fruit and vegetables. The cozy outdoor patio provides an great place for dinner or just to sip coffee (ask Umberto to show you!!) in the morning. Keep in mind that they do not accept credit cards - they accept Euro travelers checks and Euros..., and that this is not a hotel, but if you are looking for a different experience do not hesitate to stay at this great apartment.
Reviews.Author: dtsmith00

Reviews.Content: Fabulously comfortable, incredibly helpful staff Lovely building very close to all the sights, spacious and comfortable room, but best of all were the recommendations from the staff. Really helpful, bookings made if needed, although we do you wouldn't need to speak a word of Italian to get the best of Florence staying here.
Reviews.Author: Lazlo12

Reviews.Content: Perfect! Antica Dimora is a oasis of quietness in busy Florence. It is spotlessly clean and has the atmosphere one expects when staying in an old style palace. Very well decorated and cozy. Service is excellent, breakfast is really nice and you can reach the most important sights of Florence just through a short pleasant walk. I will surely recommend it and if i came back to Florence Antica Dimora will be my first choice.
Reviews.Author: Sharklady_2008

Reviews.Content: Reliable, clean and quaint This moderately priced guest house offers good value in a clean environment. You can walk to everything, and the building is old and full of character. Breakfast is very good!
Reviews.Author: satisfied133

Reviews.Content: Loved thambience This was really a special place. Not your usual hotel. Only six rooms that are inside a building with other offices/apartments, but once you're inside, you are in a warm, cozy place. Our room (#5) had a small terrace and we could sit out and enjoy the evening. The french doors had a screen so no bug problems. The bathroom facilities were the best that we had in the five places we stayed. The staff was very helpful (got us tickets to the Accademia and made a wonderful neighborhood dinner suggestion - we ate there twice). Very quiet and only a short walk to the various places to see. Highly recommend staying here.
Reviews.Author: likebeach

Reviews.Content: Loved the Johlea and the apartment We loved the friendly atmostphere of the Johlea together with the helpfulness of staff. Nothing was too much trouble and Umberto even arranged to meet us late at night to show us around when we arrived off a late evening flight from Pisa, Giovana was delightful and spent time telephoning museums for us!The apartment was a delight and so convenient to be staying right in the centre of where we needed to be - everything was only a short walk away and for a few days we were able to feel it was our very own apartment and we were Florentines and not tourists..
Reviews.Author: orlings

Reviews.Content: Great Atmosphere We read the Karen Brown reviews and tried to get a room here. We really liked the ambiance of the place. Very nicely decorated, and quiet. The staff was nice and very helpful. Walking distance to the centre, a great location. If we get back to Florence we already know where to stay.
Reviews.Author: maasssie

Reviews.Content: Charming oasis Stayed at the Antica for 3 nights in early October and just loved it. Very charming property on one level on a multi-use building. Very inviting salon and common area with music, DVDs, books, coffee and other beverages 24 hours. Several individually decorated rooms in authentic Tuscan style. The service was excellent with the staff making museum and restaurant reservations for us. Great little Irish bar across the street and wonderful restaurant (Bronzino) just around the corner. Very quiet and charming street.
Reviews.Author: jenglar

Reviews.Content: Hidden gem Antica Dimora was the perfect retreat after a busy day of sight-seeing and the hustle and bustle of the streets of Florence. We had a wonderful two nights here and wished we could have stayed for longer. The rooms are beautifully decorated in a traditional Italian style with an abundance of colour and attention to detail. Our room had a beautiful four poster bed (which I believe they all have) and a small balcony. My only complaint was that it was a little noisy in the morning but this was because we had the room closest to the breakfast room. This was not a problem though. The breakfast was good with a variety of cakes, meats, cheeses and breads etc. to choose from. It's in a good location, a little out of town, around a ten/fifteen minute walk to Il Duomo which we always enjoyed. Especially enjoyed after a long lazy evening of tasting the Florentine food and wine.I really fell in love with Antica Dimora, it's so beautifully decorated and really does feel like your home when you are staying there. We shall definitely be returning and would recommend it to all who are considering staying there.
Reviews.Author: LondonColette

Reviews.Content: anitica dimora firenze is a Florence gem What a gem in Florence with a location on a quiet street, close to the center and good price for a lovely small hotel. Don't be worried by the bare entrance and stairs, because what is waiting for you on opening the door to Antica Dimore Firenze is a beautifully designed light-filled breakfast/sitting room with tasteful comfortable seating, lovely wall art, an extremely helpful and inviting manager, and individual rooms that are romantic, well-thought out and serene. We loved it!!
Reviews.Author: oxford6

Reviews.Content: Home from home Having found this hotel featured in a Good hotel guide we decided to book the hotel for three days and took family and partners, booking 5 of the six rooms. This was our wedding trip having had the ceremony at home on the Thursday we all flew out on the Friday. We were looking for a place with atmosphere, walking distance from all the attractions of Florence and a place that would enable the members of our party to relax, congregate and plan each days options. We were not dissappointed and had the added satisfaction of rooms that captured the Italian style.The staff were more than receptive and helpful and served to make the stay so pleasurable, even three days of rain did not spoil the occassion. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to experience Florence in a way that captures the essence of this beutiful city. With comfortable rooms and a gentle pace this hotel contributed to a very special trip.Peter  Vicky, UK
Reviews.Author: Peter067

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Stay We could not have asked for more from the Antica Dimora Firenze: our rooms were comfortable and clean, the staff was courteous and helpful and the price was extremely competitive. I would definitely recommend to family and friends.
Reviews.Author: ouoneill

Reviews.Content: Beautiful stay The Hotel is one of the best places I have had the pleasure to spend a Holiday. It is a clean, quiet, peaceful and cozy Hotel, the one you would never want to leave. A place to call Home when you are away from Home. The management is excelent. Reception has always been helpful to me. You can always rely on the ladies at the desk (Amanda, Elisa and Violet are the most beautifull creatures behind the desk, you may always ask them any information, and you receive the answers in no time at all).I warmly reccomend this Hotel to anybody going to this beautiful Area of the world. Toscana is the place I left my heart, and Antica Dimora is where my memories stay.
Reviews.Author: MontrealHenry

Reviews.Content: The Ideal Solution We found the Antica Dimora Firenze to be the ideal solution for anyone we doesn't want to break the bank but have quality accommodation in a good location in central Florence.The room was comfortable and interistingly furnished. The set up was unfussy but efficient and we enjoyed the opportunity to dialogue with other guests over breakfast. Thes staff were helpfulbut not obtrusive.We have no hesitation in reccommending.Les  Fiona. Aberdeen, Scotland
Reviews.Author: LandF

Reviews.Content: A Florentine gem An excellent, quiet location and a beautiful room. So much nicer to stay in a small boutique establishment with an honesty bar and buffet breakfast than to have the stuffiness of a hotel. A thoroughly enjoyable stay!
Reviews.Author: CumbrianClimber

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Stay My partner and I stayed recently in Florence for 3 nights at the Antica Dimora Firenze. I booked the room from the hotel website, and chose it after reading reviews on Trip Adviser.We were not disappointed, the Hotel is everything promised in the website. It is well located in a beautiful old building, being only a 15 min walk or so into the heart of the city, with plenty of nice local restaurants around. The room was very clean and quite spacious, with very attractive furnishings, and a very substantial breakfast was offered, all at the amazing August rate of 100 Euros per night.The staff are warm and welcoming, and very helpful in explaining about the city and booking tours etc. I must make special mention of Elisa who spent ages helping us to find alternate accommodation in Florence when we decided to extend our stay, and unfortunately were unable to extend our booking at Antica Dimora due to the hotel being full.We would definitely recommend the hotel to others.
Reviews.Author: AussiepairSydney

Reviews.Content: Fantastic find in Firenze! We spent two nights at the Antica Dimora Firenze and would highly recommend it. We arrived there after having stayed three nights in Rome and one night in a different spot in Firenze and this was by far our favourite place to stay. Our room was charming and had a terrific little balcony with room to sit and eat breakfast. There was a breakfast each morning and an honour bar with good variety. The location was perfect as well - a 10 minute walk to downtown, but along the way there was a small grocery store and a number of bars and wine shops that had much more reasonable prices than anything we found in the tourist areas. On the final day of our stay my boyfriend was sick with a fever and the staff took the time to help us figure out what we needed to get from the Farmacia down the street. We returned with the medication that the pharmacist had recommended and she checked everything and translated the packaging for us. We will be returning to the Antica Dimora Firenze, hopefully with friends and family. It was one of the highlights of our trip to Italy!
Reviews.Author: Allyron

Reviews.Content: A gem of a find Antica Dimora is on the 2nd floor of an unimposing building in a back street of Florence about 10 min easy walk to the main areas . Our room ,number 1 , featured a 4 poster bed and was a large room with good facilities. It was also extremely quite even being street facing . The staff our wonderful providing good information and recommendations . This is a BB not hotel , so no real space outside of your bedroom but being in Florence you are not there to spend time inside . We paid 130 euros per night , which for Florence is very good value . I would recommend this place and rebook when visiting the city again .
Reviews.Author: KEWGARDENSLondon

Reviews.Content: Great Stay at A.D.F. We had a terrific stay at Antica Dimora. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms had a lovely design and were clean. Overall, it was an oasis from hectic sightseeing and a good value.
Reviews.Author: occasionaltraveler82

Reviews.Content: nice place to stay Nice little hotel in an ancient building.Charming rooms.Near all the historical monuments in Florence (walking distance)Parking nearby.
Reviews.Author: Gertjan71

Reviews.Content: Wonderful! We stayed my husband and I 3 nights in this real Gem of Florence! We are visiting Italy for our first time and starting from the North and now on our way to the Southe!Antica Dimora Firenze is a very nice and elegant BB, you fell as at your own home, with beautiful rooms, very quiet and very clean. The atmosphere is absolutely fantastic, it's a home away from home! An atmosphere that we will hardly find again in our trip across Italy!The service is excellent, Viola - Elisa - Amanda are all so helpful and professional, they will help you with all your needs. Don't forget to ask them for restaurant suggestions, they have always good tips to give you :-)The location is great, just a little walk from the main historical sites, but far enough from the crowded streets.Breakfast is really ok, and it's a nice occasion for meeting the other guests.We had also the nice surprise to have wireless all around the BB without no extra charges.We VERY HIGHLY recommend Antica Dimora Firenze!
Reviews.Author: madxfreedom

Reviews.Content: Delivers what it promises We spent three nights at the hotel, staying at room number 1.The room was quite comfortable, air-conditioned and nicely decorated (four poster bed, nice furniture). The bathroom was also nice, with complimentary toiletries provided - in short, what one would expect from a hotel in this price range.The photos on the hotel website are a very accurate representation of the room. A few points worth noting:- the hotel is actually an apartment which has been appropriately modified. Therefore, you won't find the typical hotel entrance on the ground floor - just a regular door to the apartment block.- the door to room 1 opens through the breakfast/lounge room. This is not a problem, although it was a bit of a strange feeling - if others were having breakfast when we opened the door, they saw directly into our room.- the breakfast room has one main table, and you feel as if you're having breakfast with your extended family, as strangers sit next or opposite you.All in all, on the plus side, the decoration was really of impeccable taste (both the rooms and the lounge/breakfast hall), giving you a warm and pleasant feeling. The receptionist was very helpful and offered to provide us with a map of the city, suggested itineraries for sightseeing, and even places to eat (don't miss the nearby pizzeria Zeus after a tiring day of sightseeing - quite simple but offering delicious  authentic Italian food).The breakfast itself could be somewhat improved (no honey?), but it was adequate (nothing fancy though).In terms of location: we went by car, and had to park at a private underground parking 10-15 min walk from the hotel. Although relatively far from Ponte Vecchio, Uffizi, Palazzo Vecchio  esp. from Palazzo Pitti, these main sites were still reachable on foot (20 min walk or more). It probably felt longer because of the heat. It was however very close to San Lorenzo and the Accademia/San Marco, and an OK distance from the Duomo.One last comment about price: we paid 100 euros per night through a special offer (rather than 140), and we felt the hotel was a good deal also because of this.
Reviews.Author: elan_Switzerland

Reviews.Content: Very pleasant experience       This was the bedroom that we were in.
Reviews.Author: zeroeight

Reviews.Content: The Tornabuoni House is Great Our family of four just returned from a vacation in Europe that included four nights in Florence, Italy at Antica Dimora Firenze's The Tornabuoni House. The House consists of 2 bed rooms, 2 bathrooms, a kitchen, living room, and dining area. It is located in a central, convenient, upscale, and safe area of Florence. And, it is beautifully decorated! (See the photos on their website.)Staying in such an apartment greatly enhanced our visit to Florence in many respects. Antica Dimora Firenze's staff was also excellent. We made our reservations by contacting them directly by email. The staff was prompt, courteous, and responsive in all of our communications. Also, the staff member who met us at the apartment upon our arrival (to let us into the apartment and get us situated) was prompt and extremely professional and helpful.The owners of Antica Dimora Firenze have other properties in Florence and in the Tuscany region. Based on our experience with Tournabuoni House, I would certainly plan to stay at one of their properties on future trips to the area.
Reviews.Author: WilsonNorthCarolina

Reviews.Content: excellent staying...       bath
Reviews.Author: achilleas1

Reviews.Content: Beautiful This is a charming place in a great location... its about 10 minutes from the duomo.. one street straight down... less than 5 minutes from Davids statue and generally walkable everywhere...The rooms are very cute.. we had room number 2, with the long passageway. We were very very happy with the rooms, the common areas and the staff were equally helpful and friendly... The only thing I would remind people is they do not take credit cards, which our own fault was unexpected at checkout so we had to run to the cash machine....
Reviews.Author: taimoorhusain

Reviews.Content: The best ! We travelled in many countries in Europe and stayed in many hotels or apartments, this is the best. It's an absolutely unforgettable stay. We definitely will come back and would like to thank Elisa and Mr. Umberto, hope to see you next time. Grazie ! M.Y.Lee  S. Otsuki
Reviews.Author: HMYL

Reviews.Content: Great Place! We have recently returned from our trip to Italy. One of the trip's highlight was the Antica Dimora Firenze. Amazing place, helpful staff, very nice decor and a special touch (the classical music in the lobby area with coffee, tea and cakes all day long). We had the pleasure to meet Amanda who made our trip even more succesful, booking some tours, great restaurant recomendations and florence city tips. She made us feel at home as you would welcome a friend! I would highly recommend it. Thanks for everything!
Reviews.Author: worldmember

Reviews.Content: Great hotel We stayed in Antica Dimora for 3 nights in June. We loved the room and the bathroom. NIce little hotel near the Duomo ( 10 minutes walk). No noise in the street. Good bed. Good breakfast.Would certainly recommend it .
Reviews.Author: Joensuu

Reviews.Content: Absolutely the Best -- Loved it!!! This was the perfect hotel to stay at in Florence -- I cannot say enough about how kind and helpful and capable the staff was at the hotel. They gave great advice about how to get about Florence, and were always gracious. The hotel itself was so lovely -- beautifully set up, very clean, good location and very comfortable as well. I highly recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: Nikita05

Reviews.Content: Very professional service. Lovely place Fantastic place. Lovely big room, beautifully kept. Shutters, soundproofed windows, a/c, great power shower, four poster bed (mattress was hard though). We were in room #1 which connected to the breakfast room but this didnt disturb us at all. Great breakfasts and food. Very good location; just far enough from the hustle and bustle of the centre of Florence but close enough. And it was also close to the edge of the pedestrian zone, so it was very handy for parking your car nearby without worrying that the carabinieri would clamp you. The best thing though was the service, which was very professional indeed (not what I was expecting from such a hotel of this size). Elisa was amazing and thought of everything; great recommendations of where to go/what to do, and very good dinner/Uffizi reservations etc. Please keep up the good work!!!
Reviews.Author: Tripadeedoodaa

Reviews.Content: A wonderful stay in Florence at a great price My husband and I were married at Antica Dimora Firenze's sister hotel in the Chianti Hills (Villa Il Poggiale) and were recommended this hotel by Poggiale's wonderful staff. We thought Antica Dimora Firenze was great - very homely, stylish but in a cozy way. The air-conditioning works really well, our room had a DVD player and a gorgeous four-poster bed. The staff were lovely, very helpful. I would recommend our room which was at the back of the hotel but I wouldn't stay in a room overlooking the main street - there is an Irish pub across the road which we are guessing might be a little loud!The breakfast was simple but lovely, fresh salami, good coffee a homemade cake. The hotel is a good walking distance to the Duomo - an easy 10 minute walk, and actually not being right in the heart of Florence we found good, it was nice to walk away from the hustle and bustle. We definitely recommend!
Reviews.Author: Samarv

Reviews.Content: Great find! From the very beginning the staff at Antica were responsive and helpful with my many questions. We rented 2 rooms and had an excellent stay. The rooms are great and bathrooms are fine. The price for Florence in summer was a steal. I would recommend to anyone and will certainly be returning myself!
Reviews.Author: LizardAtlanta

Reviews.Content: Fantastic place for independent travelers We love Antica Dimora Firenze and its sister properties! Small, stylish and located off the beaten tourist path, it is perfect for independent travelers who want to stay in a unique place that feels like an Italian home rather than a generic hotel. When you check in you are given the keys to the front door, to the hotel entrance on the second floor and to your room, and from there you can come and go as you please. There is no concierge at night, so the place feels more like a private apartment than a hotel. Come morning, the staff puts out a lovely breakfast buffet which you can enjoy at your leisure -- no showing your room key to prove that you are staying there, etc. Our room had a four-poster bed, a roomy and beautiful bathroom and a tiny balcony. I cannot recommend this place enough to independent travelers. Demanding, whiny people who need to be waited on hand and foot need not apply.
Reviews.Author: ALoiterer

Reviews.Content: A good base in Florence We had a very pleasant stay here in July. Our room was very quiet, the A/C worked well. The room was very clean and comfortable.Breakfast was good, but I would not call it excellent. It was practically the same the three days we were there. A couple of cereal options, no granola and no bran based cereals. One cheese and one kind of ham. Two choices of bread. Very good coffee, bread and jams. A different cake every day. Fruit. Tea and coffee were available the whole day, as well as fruit, that was good. An excellent breakfast would have had a salad, some eggs option and more dairy.In my view the location is perfect. It is far enough from the center of the city to be quiet, but close enough to walk everywhere.People are very nice and friendly, giving very good recommendations. They also handled the reservations for the museums for us ahead of time. They had good email communication.I don't think I'm going back to Florence anytime soon, but if I were to I would definitely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: adar

Reviews.Content: Above and beyond at the Antica Dimora Firenze My daughter was injured and the hotel was so helpful. They called our car service, let us stay in our room even though we had checked out. They just went above and beyond to help us. The room was clean and comfortable and very spacious. It was centrally located too. I would highly recommend the hotel.
Reviews.Author: lisa_kinnear

Reviews.Content: Feelling allrigth My nephew and his wife, who were living in Barcelona, told us about Antica Dimora and gave us a picture (un triptico). Then I wrote an email to Residenza Johannna I and finally we got two rooms in Antica Dimora Firenze.We loved the place, really. It was a greate experience arriving every day at nigth-time, open the door and listen to some piano music at a very low level coming from the jukebox in that beautifull living-room.The room was very comfortable, the bathroom was spacious and the shower with a lot of water falling directly to my head (I'm 1.94 mts tall). The bed was nice and we could sleep very well.Breakfast was good: good cofee, bread, cheese and salami. In that conditions, every day was a great Firenze waiting for us.
Reviews.Author: MarcosGuillermo

Reviews.Content: don't tell everyone about it... A lovely guesthouse. Small, very tastefully designed, comfortable, a refuge from the heat of July days, and extremely helpful and friendly service. All at a pretty reasonable rate -- please don't tell everyone about it otherwise there won't be space for me to go back there.....! Highly recommended.
Reviews.Author: OllieGatti

Reviews.Content: Loved Antica Dimora and The Market House, J We stayed at the Antica Dimora Firenze for 2 nights and The Market House for 3 nights and both were all we required and more for a wonderful walking based sightseeing trip to Florence. Both properties were in close proximity to the sights but sufficiently tucked away from the crowds with fantastic local bars, restaurants and markets nearby. Special mention needs to be made for the excellent staff who arranged our accomodation at short notice, sorted out our late arrival outside of their usual working hours and, in particular, Umberto for ferrying us and our bags for the changeover and showing us around The Market House. The Market House, in a central and popular part of the city, allowed us to take in a slice of Florentine life and by the time we left we really felt we had got to know the place well and our way around - it was a shame we didn't stay longer to explore the local area more. No problems with wi-fi at Antica Dimora and free internet access all day to 7pm at the cafe in Piazza Sant'Ambrogio, 1 minutes walk from The Market House, meant that a small business could be kept running in relaxing surroundings whilst being away on holiday.
Reviews.Author: LondonJandA

Reviews.Content: Antica Dimora Firenze The hotel Antica Dimora Firenze is a very nice hotel. There are beverages available at any time, wake up call etc and the hospitality is wonderful. It is a bit of a walk from Il Duomo, I had a 6 year old with me and if I had to do it again, I would stay closer but only for him. He managed just fine however. We had a small problem with the A/C, but they fixed it right away and let us stay at a sister hotel, bigger rooms for the same rate. The benefit of staying with them is that there is a Lava Secco (wash and dry laundrymat) only 1 block away. Pick up soap at the 1 euro store and you can wash ALL your clothes very cheaply. Washing clothes can be a challenge in Italy. The rooms are nicely furnished and a very good value. We had 3 in the room, thus we got a little cramped but it worked out fine. The price/value was excellent. Great breakfast as well.
Reviews.Author: KarenMinnesota

Reviews.Content: A very comfortable stay I had a very pleasant week staying in this quiet, comfortable hotel, with very helpful and friendly staff. I recommend it.
Reviews.Author: Putneyman

Reviews.Content: Feel at home The Antica Dimora Firenze is a beautiful and cozy place. I, my sister and my mother loved it and felt like if we are at home. The room was confortable, clear, quiet, with a beautiful decoration. The breakfast was so good. Antica has only six rooms and the employees are very kind.
Reviews.Author: MARIARioDeJaneiro

Reviews.Content: Fantastic A great find! Excellent location (only 10 minute walk to city centre). Lovely room (number 4 -- away from the main street -- quiet). Comfortable bed, and large shower. Friendly and helpful staff. Delicious breakfast. Would definitely recommend.
Reviews.Author: candyflossCardiff

Reviews.Content: Everything we wanted and more! I only wish we would have had more time!!! My 2 girlfriends and I stayed 2 nights here at the Market House. Decor was adorable, and this was near everything you wanted to see in Florence. The market, which is right outside of your front door, has the freshest, most amazing produce, flowers, etc. Made breakfast in our kitchen one morning. They also had some great clothing there as well, which we took advantage of. On our last day we realized there were also some amazing shops on nearby streets (Via de La Croce, I think). Mr. Unberto was very friendly and helpful. He even pointed out where we could listen to some music and enjoy some evening cultural activities - also right by the apartment. We saw a bellydancing performances while we enjoyed some ice cream!Overall, we stayed in 3 hotels/accommodations during our trip to Italy, and this was absolutely the best experience of all. Thank you!!!!
Reviews.Author: MLRusa

Reviews.Content: Charming and comfortable, with friendly hosts! After rolling our suitcases from the train station through the dusty streets of Florence on a warm day, we arrived at this little inn's address with hope and expectation. We were not disappointed. We received a warm welcome in lovely English from Amanda as soon as we came in the front door. The public area of the inn is full of comfortable chairs and cheerful colors.Our room was spacious and equally welcoming, with jasmine flourishing outside the window. This inn is very different from most others, both in its price category and well beyond: everything is designed to make you feel that you are a guest in a soothing private home. There are beautiful fabrics for the curtains and bed canopy, scatter rugs on the floor, well-chosen prints (that you enjoy looking at!) all over the walls. The closet had loads of hangers, and a sachet. Drawers were lined with pretty paper. The bed was large and comfortable with a lovely Indian spread. We found hooks to hang our hats, a table and chairs to use as a desk or for breakfast, and good reading lamps, along with the usual hotel conveniences. The bathroom exceeded expectations. The shower had a drenching rain showerhead, a handspray, and a tile bench. The large old marble sinktop was marvelous, and there was excellent lighting, very good toiletries, and fine linens, including thin, absorbent bathsheets (linen?) that dried overnight. It was not hotel slick, but totally indulgent! We loved it. Breakfast was delicious: breads and jam, yogurt, cereal, fruit, a fresh tart or cake, juice, tea. We usually dashed across the street to the pastry shop for fresh creme-filled cornetti to accompany all the other good things at the more English-style buffet, and feasted in our room. Our only issue was that the free wireless would not work for our Macintosh, although Amanda made several calls to their tech person on our behalf and really tried to help us. My husband was able to use his iPhone instead. We moved (reluctantly) to a three-star hotel for our last night in Florence and were told we'd have to pay by the half-hour for wireless. This seemed archaic and stingy in comparison!The location is a little ways out of the hubbub of the Centro Storico, but we liked the neighborhood. We were close to the Accademia and San Marco, and that train station hike wasn't bad.This is a lovely, quiet jewel of a Florentine BB, at a very good price.
Reviews.Author: The_Bostonians

Reviews.Content: Home away from Home We recently stayed 3 nights in this small (6 rooms), quiet hotel near the Accademia. Our room was clean, nicely decorated with a canopy bed plus hand painted on the walls and ceiling. The 'living room' was comfortable, the staff very helpful, and the breakfast perfect to start the day. Each guest is given a key, as the staff is not on site overnight (close by in case of an emergency) making it very homey. Easy walking to all areas of the city. We highly recommend the Antica Dimora Firenze and would definitely stay again when in Florence.
Reviews.Author: MissyLu

Reviews.Content: Charming spot in fantastic Firenze! Really great stay! Wonderful room, comfy bed and good shower/bath, location and yummy breakfast! We would stay here again for sure!
Reviews.Author: DandDCali

Reviews.Content: Fantastic - terrific location  A perfect gem of a hotel in Florence. The staff could not have been more helpful. I was especially thankful that they helped me makes restaurant reservations at two places that I also highly recommend 鈥?Omero  Trattoria Sostanza.
Reviews.Author: SodaSanFran

Reviews.Content: Super romantic B I stayed in both Antica diMora Firenze and AD Johlea and both places were lovely, extremely romantic and so well decorated. The rooms were really lovely and we had a great stay with my husband.The staff was very helpful from the beginning and gave us great recommendations of where to eat in Florence. They were always willing to attend our needs.AD Johlea was especially charming due to their terrace, which has a nice view overlooking Florence and the surrounding areas.The only disadvantage of our stay was the noise. The rooms were not very well insolated; this was not a problem at night since there was not activity; but in the afternoon, when wanting to take a nap to rest before dinner, it was hard to get good rest.The other drawback is they do not accept any type of credit cards, but you can always get money from ATMs which are easy to find.We would recommend this place to anyone who is wanting to stay in a very romantic, quaint place, for an affordable price. It is worth it!
Reviews.Author: Peanut6006

Reviews.Content: romantic holiday After reading great reviews my husband and I stayed at this lovely special bb. It was more than we expected - quiet, romantic, located in a lovely street, and so different to staying at a hotel. It made our visit to Florence perfect, and the staff was so helpfull and friendly - especially Amanda, who was lovely to talk to and made us feel welcome. Breakfast was special, and although it rained some of the days - we found it nice to sit at the living room and read a book. We stayed at room number 4 which is a little smaller but very sweet. We recommend Antica Dimora to our friends!!
Reviews.Author: osnatik2

Reviews.Content: Lovely stay and warm service We chose Antica Dimora Firenze based on the Tripadvisor reviews and can confirm that it is a wonderful property! We stayed for a long weekend and enjoyed the quiet neighborhood around Via San Gallo where this BB is located. The bedroom was beautifully furnished, the bed very comfortable. A few toiletries in the bathroom were a great touch considering some BBs these days hardly provide anything for their guests. The atmosphere was warm and friendly - the staff at reception were helpful with restaurant recommendations and planning our train journey. Breakfast was a great way to meet others staying at the property and getting advice from the staff to plan our day.We felt very comfortable in the lounge area in the evening - it felt as if we were staying in our own apartment. There are DVDs to borrow and an honor bar.The only potential drawback I would warn against older travelers or those with plenty of luggage is that Antica Dimora is on the 2nd floor of the building and I am not sure if there was a lift available. It's good exercise going up the stairs but definitely manageable.Overall, I would highly recommend Antica Dimora Firenze to anyone wanting a peaceful, warm and friendly stay! Now I would love to check out their sister property in Chianti after our great experience.
Reviews.Author: Merkey

Reviews.Content: Grat place to stay in Florence Great place to stay. They were really helpful with our stay at Florence. Breakfast was really tasty. The hotel is really well located. It's a place to go back!!
Reviews.Author: Pasaxe

Reviews.Content: Relaxed, quiet, elegant My husband and I enjoyed Antica Dimore Firenze tremendously. The rooms are clean and nicely proportioned, with beautiful furnishings and small but more than adequate enuite bathroom. Comfortable beds and a quiet location allowed us a great sleep. Breakfast was more than adequate 鈥?with a choice of juices and pastries as well as fruit and cereal. Coffee and tea are available all day and the staff were here to assist us with any concerns, or requirements. They have a laundry service as well! Highly recommended.
Reviews.Author: huronshores

Reviews.Content: Homey with a great staff Antica Dimora Firenze was a cute and homey hotel with a very competent staff. Amanda and Elisa were very welcoming and helpful. In fact, I think they are the best part of staying at this hotel. At my request, they obtained reservations to the Accademia and the Uffizi, without the usual markup as on the websites! They made dinner reservations for us and were ready to help with any reasonable request. As to the accommodations: the rooms were bed-and-breakfast type- quaint and fairly roomy for our needs. However, there was some worry as to the large step up to get to the bathroom, and each of the 6 rooms has this. SInce I was travelling with my 75-year old parents, this was a real concern for their middle-of-the-night needs. The self-serve breakfast at Antica Dimora Firenze was sufficient, but not spectacular. Again- homey feel, with toasts, jams, cereals,and juices to eat at a communal table. The location of this hotel was a bit more out of the way than I would have hoped. Next time I will probably stay more centrally located.
Reviews.Author: singinsweetie

Reviews.Content: Charming Boutique Hotel We were blown away by the quality of the rooms and the service at Antica Dimora. We had had disappointing experiences at other 'boutique' hotels in other Italian cities and so were bracing ourselves for more of the same.Luckily, our fears were unfounded. The room was large and the bed so comfortable. There was also an armchair and 2 desks in the room. The bathroom was immaculate, with a full size bath and shower head.Breakfast was delicious and generous. The service very friendly and personable.*Highly* recommended
Reviews.Author: cat_dave

Reviews.Content: Very accomodating       Sunday market
Reviews.Author: 11smiles

Reviews.Content: Friendly, Warm, Inviting!!! This was a charming hotel. I stayed in Room #1 which was away from the street. The door is right next to the Reception Desk but I did not experience any disturbance, noise, or inconvenience. I liked the hallway back to the bedroom area because it was so peaceful. There is a door to a sitting area outside (cozy--it has 1 chair--I thought it was just right for a quiet time to read). The room was very clean, loved the antiques, and the service was wonderful. Uta was the lovely receptionist and helped our group find our way around Florence.The reception room offered breakfast in the morning, coffee, tea and other goodies in the afternoon. Just loved my stay and would definitely go back.
Reviews.Author: Marion27

Reviews.Content: The best in Florence Five nights in heaven. If Florence is the best open museum in Italy, then the Antica Dimora is the best Dimora (a place to stay) in town. The accommodation, the surrounding, the view from the window (especially the yellow leaves of March) and the package deal, including Amanda's advises, smiles and concerning for your comfort (Don't forget to ask for her)鈥?and never forget the excellent beds of room No. 6.
Reviews.Author: amirabar

Reviews.Content: A Charming Centrally Located Bed  A gem of a place to stay in Florence. Well furnished bedrooms, excellent bathrooms  a good buffet breakfast. All the staff are friendly and recommend good restaurants.There is a lovely cosey feel to the main living/breakfast room, where you can help yourself to tea or coffee  biscotti. There are lots of maps, leaflets  information at Reception.I cannot praise this B  B highly enough. There's only one slight criticism  that is the bed could have been more comfortable. Apart from that, you couldn't find a better place to stay at a reasonable price.
Reviews.Author: Anglia_7

Reviews.Content: Wonderfully friendly and helpful ... My husband  I stayed for 3 nights in mid-March. With one email request from me, Amanda made 2 museums reservations and 3 dinner reservations. The entire staff is very organized  helpfuf about local information. When my husband became ill on the second day, Amanda helped to get him medicines, changed our car rental, and made other arrangements to help us deal with the situation, including allowing us to stay in the room past check out time. The room, # 3, facing the street, was small but clean as was the bathroom. There was some noise from the Irish Pub across the street that made it mandatory to keep the window closed at night. We will definitely stay there for our next trip to Florence. Continental breakfast, as others have noted, was quite good.
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityTrekker

Reviews.Content: Charming Charming, clean, well-decorated BB. Service was helpful and kind.Ok location, close to Museum San Marco with Fra Angelico paintings, but not that close from Ponte Vecchio or Santa Croce.Avoid room #1 next to the reception, it is very small, the bathroom and the closet are right at the entrance but you reach the room after a long corridor, not very convenientIt is too close to the reception and we could here all her telephone conversations.
Reviews.Author: Xuan

Reviews.Content: Wonderful base from which to explore Florence After driving through the Tuscan countryside for 5 days we dropped the rental car off at the Florence airport and took a taxi to Antica Dimora Firenze. We were graciously welcomed and able to check into our room as soon as we arrived early in the afternoon. We were glad we packed light as it is up three flights of stairs. The room was small but well appointed and had everything we needed to provide a comfortable base from which to explore Florence. The private bath was especially nice, there was ample closet space and the small safe in the closet was convenient. The living room, where breakfast was served, also had an honor bar with wine and spirits and coffee and tea available anytime. If you plan to do a lot of shopping (which we didn't) it is a bit of a walk from the center of Florence if you need to drop off parcels. But that also proved a bonus as it was quiter than we had expected it to be a night. Overall a great place to stay when in Florence. We would definitely return.
Reviews.Author: LMKAnnArbor

Reviews.Content: beautifull The hotel is so lovely, people is very kind and the position of the hotel is perfeect to visit Florence by walk. Rooms are so charming, perfect for a romantic week-end or more. We think that we will back soon, we loved the omni.
Reviews.Author: efriita

Reviews.Content: excellent hotel Enjoyed a very comfortable 2 night stay at the Antica Dimora. Good sized bedroom with a really comfortable queen size bed. Well furnished and elegant is how I would describe this hotel. It's in a good position - quiet but close to the centre (10 minute walk to the duomo). Breakfast was very good. I thoroughly recommend the hotel.
Reviews.Author: rickLondon_Uk

Reviews.Content: Romantica / Antica A peacefull oasis in the middle of buzing Florence.The classical music in the lobby set the tone for a unforgetable stay in the top city of arts in Europe (the world?).Great beds, good bathroom, fantastic advice from friendly staf that know all the good places to eat.Just a stroll from the Medici's Palazos of and the heart of Florence.
Reviews.Author: voyageurEurope

Reviews.Content: The perfect place to stay in Firenze From the first contact I made with Antica Dimora I knew our stay would be a good one. . I booked this as a surprise big birthday present for my husband and wanted our stay to be perfect. The many questions I emailed to the hotel prior to arriving were dealt with promptly, efficiently and graciously and I knew that we would have nothing to worry about. As soon as we entered Antica Dimora we felt that we were in the real Firenze rather than an hotel from a souless hotel chain. The beautifully coloured and decorated rooms are just as pictured on the website. The huge canopied bed in our room was deliciously comfortable and even though we overlooked the main street the room was extremely peaceful.The reception is open from 8am - 8pm and is staffed by a team of women who go out of their way to share their extensive depth of knowledge and love of the city. They provided many recommendations for where to eat and drink and without exception every one was spot on. The nearby restaurant Taverna Bronzino was nothing short of perfect as a recommendation for my husband's birthday meal, not just for the food but for first class service with a smile. All in all Antica Dimora Firenze is more like having your own luxury apartment in Firenze but with the advantage of having your own top class concierge. Don't even bother looking for anywhere else!
Reviews.Author: coreleygirl

Reviews.Content: Gorgeous! Beautiful little place in a great location with really friendly, welcoming staff. The rooms are gorgeous - loved the four-poster bed! And the little touches really made the difference, such as the decanter of amaretto and amaretti biscuits left out in the evenings - just the thing after a tiring day out exploring the city! Would love to go back.
Reviews.Author: snailsrus

Reviews.Content: Delightful and homey My sister and I fell in love at first sight, stepping into the colorful parlor, being greeted by the warm receptionist. Our room was gorgeous with a big bed with canopy, a telephone we could use to call home to family, and a bathroom that included a roomy tub. And the price was reasonable for Europe. We met some of our favorite people who were also staying there, over breakfast the first morning. A good location within walking distance of the Duomo, on the north end of the center of the city, surrounded by some fine restaurants and coffee shops. We found out from others staying there that we could have negotiated for a better price because we were staying there during off-season.
Reviews.Author: mamjaj

Reviews.Content: Perfect! What a gem! Book early, as there are only 6 delightful rooms. The staff is so helpful, I felt like I was staying at my grandmother's house, so cozy and warm. The room was perfect, bathroom large by Euro standards. Breakfast simple and delicious. Great value!
Reviews.Author: dance37

Reviews.Content: I want to go back!! My husband and I stayed here for our first three nights in Italy, then decided that we needed another night at the end of our holiday! The hotel is in a great location, and is so quiet and cozy. Both of the rooms we had were so nicely decorated and comfortable. The staff is is nice and helpful with reservations and maps and recommendations for restaurants. It was nice to come back after an afternoon seeing the sights to a hot cup of tea or coffee in our room. The weather was chilly, but Antica Dimora was warm and welcoming. I was so impressed with everything about it!
Reviews.Author: LisaV59

Reviews.Content: Enchanting We were enchanted with the intimacy and warmth of this boutique hotel. Especially loved the colorful fabrics with the backdrop of antiques, tile floors and bright colored walls. The frosting on the cake was the friendly, helpful staff. The only detail that could have improved our experience would have been better coffee, but good coffee bars are within walking distance. We hope to come back!The Beiers and Latimers.
Reviews.Author: roxie40

Reviews.Content: Excellent hospitality Our family stayed in Antica Dimora Firenze for 5 nights while on a Thanksgiving vacation to Italy. We deliberately wanted to stay in cozy Italian hotels/inns rather than standard chain hotels. This one was an excellent choice.The location is wonderful - walking distance to all major attractions. The decor was lovely and relaxing. Our rooms were larger than the other rooms that we stayed in while in Italy and were tastefully appointed. We slept well during our stay.We had everything that we could possibly need. The hotel staff was excellent. They provided us with maps, directions, suggestions, and a cheery bon journo every morning. Because we were traveling with our two sons, we required two rooms. The cost was very reasonable.Honestly, we could not have been more pleased and would recommend this hotel to anyone. In fact, if we ever go back to Florence this is where we will stay.Grazie!
Reviews.Author: sallyq55

Reviews.Content: Such a wonderful stay! Location is easy to get to from the train station by foot. The service is oustanding... they are willing to accomodate you and help you in anyway. Lovely rooms and extraordinary attention to detail! I would reccomend Antica Dimora to anyone.
Reviews.Author: ShiraFish

Reviews.Content: excellent Excellent relationship quality/price, very kind and helpful reception, lovely room and bathroom.
Reviews.Author: augustman

Reviews.Content: wonderful homely place to stay in gorgeous Florence We stayed here for four nights in November and were very happy with the hotel and particularly with the very friendly and helpful staff. Nothing was too much trouble for them, and each enquiry was answered with a smile. Our room was very comfortable and clean, and we were not disturbed by traffic noise. The location is good if you are happy to walk 10-15 minutes into the main part of the city. The walk is easy and flat so it did not cause us any problem. There is an Irish pub across the road which shows someof the English football games - which kept my fiance happy while I kept shopping. Make sure you arrive with some space in your cases!
Reviews.Author: noonycat

Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience - warm and friendly The rooms are decorated with very good taste, the batthrooms very clean and the living room gives a very special feeling, very homy. But above all, the staff is extremely friendly and makes evrything to ensure that you have a wonderful stay. We recommend this address without hesitation.
Reviews.Author: A_happy_traveller059

Reviews.Content: Very pleasnt stay We liked it very much. After a depressing journey from London to Florence by train and arriving nearly 5 hours late, it was lovely to go into this warm welcoming apartment and be shown our beautiful room with everything needful in it - plenty of room to put clothes, guide books and eveything, smart bathroom area with lots of towels ( unlike another reviewer we found the large table-cloth-like towels perfectly comfortable and effective!) and large comfy bed. We were lucky to be at the back of the building, and in the room with the little balcony, because I imagine rooms at the front will be noisy - via San Gallo is a city street, not a leafy suburb. We also liked the Tuscan Classical radio station piped through to the room, but of course you could turn it off if it didn't suit you!Breakfast was fine, fresh fruit, yogurt, sliced meat and cheese available as well as cereal and the usual bread and toast. You could make tea and coffee for yourself whenever you wanted, and evening drinks - wine, brandy and other spirits - were laid out for you to help yourself on an honesty basis.Perhaps the nicest thing of all was the friendliness and helpfulness of the various receptionists. They booked museums for us, and seemed to have a real interest in our having a good stay in Florence, and gave us a nice welcome every time we returned to the apartment.One thing gave us some uneasiness: no staff are in the hotel overnight, and we did wonder about this from a safety aspect. What if a fire? or someone having a heart attack?? Most visitors I would guess are not Italians and probably do not speak much more than phrase-book Italian.
Reviews.Author: agedvoyager

Reviews.Content: Fabulous apartment by Mercato If you want to feel like a native in Firenze, book yourself into the charming Casa Del Mercato apartment run by the Antica Dimora Firenze hotel folks. Right next to the REAL market of Firenze, the Sant'Ambrogio Mercato. Great location across street from Cibreo, one of Florence's best restaurants. Quiet, fully air-conditioned, well-equipped kitchen, flat screen tv, spacious living room, and a garden in back to boot. Gracious hosts at main hotel will help smooth your arrivals and logistics.
Reviews.Author: marylane

Reviews.Content: What an excellent find       Our balcony (Room 5)
Reviews.Author: Teresa72

Reviews.Content: a nice place to stay i wanted to thank the team and umberto for the very nice reception and the perfect stay in your very nice place.till next time all the best michael
Reviews.Author: lupoVienna

Reviews.Content: Good Little Find We just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel and found it to be very accomodating. Readers need to know that this is really almost an apartment like hotel with 6 rooms. When you enter the building, you feel as if you are walking into an apartment building. The hotel is on the second floor. This threw me off initially. However, our room was fairly spacious for Europe with a lovely bathroom and small terrace. The bed was the most comfortable we encountered throughout our various stays in Italy. We found the hotel very quiet however, if you are unfortunate enough to have inconsiderate travelers staying anywhere in this hotel, it would be extremely disruptive as everything is very close. Breakfasts were average - cakes, cereals, yogurt, coffee - enough to get you going for the day. Several of the front desk people were a little scattered and lost track of what they were requested to do. One of the restaurant recommendations they gave was poor so we went on our own after night one. Overall, this little place grew on me as the days passed and I would not hesitate to stay here again, especially for the price.
Reviews.Author: Gorgas1

Reviews.Content: What a wonderful find! We just returned from a 9 day trip to Italy which included Rome, Florence and Venice. We spent 3 nights at the Antica Dimora Firenza at the beginning of March. We had a lovely stay. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. This room was the best value of all the places that we stayed while visting Italy. We paid 95 Euro. Please be advised that they do not accept credit cards, but they do accept travelers checks and do not charge any fees to cash them. The room was huge by European Standards that boasted a king-sized canopy bed. It was so romantic! The shower was also great. The room rate includes a good breakfast including pastries, cheese, cereal and yogurt. We especially enjoyed the sitting area in the evenings, where tea, Vin Santo and biscotti were provided.This property is a short walk to all of the sites which allowed us to see other areas besides the main tourist attractions. I would definitely recommend this property if you are visiting Florence.
Reviews.Author: Focus_girl

Reviews.Content: A dingy disappointment       Room 4, December 2006
Reviews.Author: Shyster951

Reviews.Content: Hidden Treasure - Worth the Money!!! This hotel is a piece of heaven and absolutely breathe taking!! Our room was spacious, spotless, beautifully decorated, and very QUIET!! The staff was very helpful and gave us several suggestions of place to eat and visit. They have a great breakfast
Reviews.Author: bragger

Reviews.Content: Hidden Treasure       View of the balcony
Reviews.Author: Pandai

Reviews.Content: Put your feet up after sightseeing We stayed in this little hotel during a three day city break in Florence in October 2006. From the outside it is unprepossessing - a small door in an anonymous facade, a poky lift to the second floor. But this is when it changes. It has a lovely reception area and several large bedrooms furnished with elegance and decorated in modern, elegant Tuscan pinks and other subdued colours. Loos and bathing facilities well up to standard, and, for us, a little balcony at the back to rest and reflect on the glory that is Florence. Breakfast adequate, and with some nice touches, such as Florentine chocolate cake, to set you up for the day. It is excellently situated to catch the major attractions, most less than fifteen minutes stroll. Forget buses and taxis in the city centre - they wait in queues while you walk past.Most of all, you are sure of a very warm welcome. We found the staff excellent - friendly, polite, efficient, and extremely helpful. We would certainly go there again. If you would like a superior bolthole at a modest price (roughly 鈧?30 per room per night), then this is the place for you.
Reviews.Author: Chipmalcs

Reviews.Content: Market House Suite Apartment Rather than staying in the Antica Dimora BB (which has fabulous reviews on Trip Advisor), my mother and I stayed 4 days in their charming Market House Suite Apartment. It was lovely fun renting a flat rather than staying in a hotel -- a style of travel which my mother and I always prefer. We make our own breakfasts, usually return home in the afternoon for a light lunch or snack, then out for dinner every evening. The property was very well stocked and maintained, and the patio would have been fantastic if the weather was warmer. The decor is very charming, and the kitchen adorable. The only major downside was the very unfortunate smell through the bathroom due to recent rains. We realize such problems come with old buildings in old cities, and my mother and I were still very pleased with the flat, but most others might not feel as comfortable. Additionally, the flat has no telephone service. Luckily I had my mobile and could call for taxis or other necessities. If you don't travel with your mobile, be prepared to use a nearby pay phone.The location of the flat is a bit far from the historical centre, but you feel like a real Florentine. Across the street is a fabulous fruit, veg  cheese market which is open nearly every morning. Additionally, next door is the Cibreo restaurant complex which is delicious, and La Giostra (our absolute favourite) is a very short walk away. We usually travelled to and from the city centre by taxi.We were welcomed to the flat by Umberto, who helped us find all the local necessities (including a nearby grocery for my Diet Cokes and the local wash  dry for our laundry). As a tip, I recommend asking the maid to come every day rather than every 3rd day to make life a bit easier for you.And finally, I feel I need to make one comment about the service from the Antica Dimora BB. Two months in advance, I had asked them to make dinner reservations during our stay. They emailed me back confirmation, then I reconfirmed again a week before our arrival. However, three of the four nights there were no reservations when we arrived at the restaurant. We do not know if this was the hotel's or the restaurants' mistake, but I recommend making dinner reservations yourself (most places will speak English).
Reviews.Author: Girl_Abroad

Reviews.Content: Loved this B  Have just returned from fabulous honeymoon trip, and had a great 2 night stay in this lovely B  B in Florence. Our room was very attractive - great bed! Would suggest trying to stay on non-street side - the scooters and traffic in the morning are loud. We had the room off the eating area, and found fellow traveller's words easy to hear! The breakfast was fresh, and the staff SO helpful and concerned. Our lost baggage became their problem to help with, which they did admirably. Uta, our main contact, was a delight - she also gave us a nice bottle of wine to ease the pain of the lost bags, as well to celebrate our honeymoon. Her tips were great for shops and touring the city - she recommended going to see The David at 5:30PM - when there are NO crowds - she was right!! We loved a nearby restaurant called Tito's, another not too far away called Za Za. We would stay here again, and look forward to trying the Il Poggiale outside of Florence next time too.
Reviews.Author: MrKins

Reviews.Content: Great place to stay!       Our bedroom...with porch!
Reviews.Author: cyndec

Reviews.Content: A few practical observations       2 twin beds
Reviews.Author: Googlehead

Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay This was a wonderful place to stay! The staff were incredibly helpful and spoke fluent English. They explained the city to us with their map, showing us where many of the sites were that we planned to visit. They made excellent, local suggestions for dinner and even called restaurants for us to make reservations. Our room was very quiet, very pleasantly decorated, good hot water, adequate air conditioning, firm bed. They gave us a bottle of wine as it was our honeymoon. Breakfast consisted of coffee, tea, a fresh pastry each day, bread and cereal. Good location, about a 10 min. walk from the train station (with luggage--sidewalks are narrow!) We highly recommend this bb.
Reviews.Author: Jmboston

Reviews.Content: Really Tops B My family and I had a great stay for four nights in early June 2006. We enjoyed two large, comfortable rooms, one of them having a small balcony overlooking an interior patio. Reasonably priced. The bathrooms were very good with lots of hot water. The place is very quiet and restful at night; one does not notice the other guests. Everything is squaky clean.The breakfast, included in the price of the room, was very good and generous, including fresh fruits, cheeses, breakfast meats, hot and cold cereals, coffeecake, etc. Coffee was excellent and is available thoughout the day. At night one can have biscotti with vino santo as a nitecap.Location is very good; all major sights are nearby, e.g., 5 minutes to the Academia; 10 to Piazza de la Signoria. One can also walk to Santa Maria Novella train station, about 20-30 minutes.Staff is friendly, knowledgable and helpful. Their recommendations to good, moderateley priced restaurants nearby proved to be accurate.Their web site is user friendly and presents faithfully the reality of the place. We would definitely stay there again.
Reviews.Author: OdiseoPR

Reviews.Content: Great B We stayed at the Antica Dimora in Florence and found a quiet BB in a residential area about 5 minutes walk from the Accademia. The rooms are nicely furnished, have great air conditioning, and the nicest bathrooms we encountered in two weeks in Italy. The staff (Ilanit and Uta) were terrific with reservations, recommendations and responded to every need. The restaurants in the neighborhood were excellent. If you want to stay in a quiet section of Florence but near the main sights, Antica Dimora is a great choice.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Old world charm Just returned from 2 wks in Italy. Lucked into the Antica Dimora Firenze in Florence. Tucked into a quiet sidestreet, the B  B is in a centuries old building, but the efficient, small elevator was appreciated. Upon arrival, we were pleasantly greeted into a charming setting. There is a definite old world,but not stuffy charm. It was mid afternoon, but a table was laid out with fruit, biscott, liquor, teas or coffee.Very continental, stylish appointments  furnishings in the main room. Our bedroom had a canopy bed, antique furnishings, a beautiful color scheme of pale blues, crimson  cream. We also have to give very high marks to the hostesses at the front desk-very accomodating, helpful. No one was irritated to pick up a phone, make a reservation for dinnner or museum. We felt very happy there  would definitely return.Debbie  Rick Greene
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
